doc.field: Letter from William F. Cody to John R. Brennan, June 20, 1907

Boston June 20th/07
Major John R. Brennan Pine Ridge
Dear Major
Sam Lone Bear1 goes home to take his wife who is very sick. Lone Bear is a good riliable manâ€” Any favor you can show him will be appreciated
By yours truly W. F. Cody
Note 1: Very likely Samuel Lone Bear, known as "Sammy," who was one of the Wild West performers photographed by Gertrude Kasebier in 1898. His father, Sam Lone Bear, and younger sister Mary had also been among Kasebier's subjects. A surviving show contract from the 1907 season lists this person's name as "Sammie Lone Bear."
